thread.title: Pakistan defeat arch-rivals India in Blind World Cup T20
thread.title_full: Pakistan defeat arch-rivals India in Blind World Cup T20

author: Sports Desk
title: Pakistan defeat arch-rivals India in Blind World Cup T20
text:
Share Tweet Email PHOTO COURTESY: PBCC 
Pakistan Blind Cricket Team defeated India by seven wickets their T20 Blind World Cup encounter at the Delhi Feroz Shah Kotla Stadium on Wednesday. 
India, after electing to bat first, scored 204-5 in their 20 overs courtesy opener Prakash’s 90 off 56 balls. For Pakistan, Muhammad Akram bagged one wicket. 
In their chase, Pakistan reached the target in 15.3 overs courtesy middle-order batsman Muhammad Zafar’s 88 off 52 balls after opener Nisar Ali gave the team a good 30-ball 45-run start. Muhammad Zafar was the man of the match for his unbeaten 88. PHOTO COURTESY: PBCC 
For India, Deepak Malik and Ketan Patel bagged one wicket each.
